WorkItem.ClosedComment: Not within Rawr's scope, there are other tools that can accomplish this
WorkItem.Description:
Would it be possible to develop some kind of tool, either stand-alone or incorporated into Rawr, that could analyze your real raid performance, and make suggestions or tell you what you did wrong?
Â 
Rawr already figures out your rotation.  For example, in the shadow priest module, it tells you your cast order.  If you could point it to your raid log, it could just look through that log for the name of the character you currently have loaded, and then tell you how much that deviates from the suggested optimized rotation.

Comments.Message: That's rather far outside the realm of Rawr's responsibilities. You'll want to use the Timeline feature in World of Logs for that.

While not exactly what your asking for, a combination of Ovale addon and Recount, can show you how close to 'perfect' your rotation is.  Ovale can be programed with your custom rotations as well, if you want to.

Actually, speaking of logs, is there a good log analyzer that isn't based on some website that can get me better accuracy than Recount?

Recount's variance over a group really bothers me, and the log parsing sites I've seen all require being registered as a guild or need software installed on my system, which is way too serious for the casual viewing I want to do.
Just use World of Logs. Yes, it's a website, but that's not a bad thing. It's really fast, easy, etc. Definitely not too serious for casual viewing.
(And you don't need to be part of a guild on it to use it or anything, personal logs are fine too)
For offline log parsing I like www.gurre.eu/wowlogparser/ (you download a java-based parser that runs on your machine as an executable).
